draft.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a piece of writing or a plan that is not yet in its finished form
draft.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: the rough draft of his new novel
I read the first draft and thought it was very good.
All parties eventually approved the final draft (=finished form) of the peace treaty.
draft.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a written order for money to be paid by a bank, especially from one bank to another
draft.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a system in which professional teams choose players from colleges to join their teams
draft.translation[0].note_box[0].section: The second draft of the agreement contained a few important changes.
He showed me the final draft of his letter.
Could you let me see a rough draft of your report?
The hero had a different name in the original draft of the story.
In earlier drafts of the speech, he criticized the pace of political progress.
A preliminary draft of the charter has been issued.
Always write a rough draft of your essay first.
He drew up a draft of the club’s rules and regulations.
The draft was approved by the Senate.
draft.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to write a plan, letter, report etc that will need to be changed before it is in its finished form
draft.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Eva’s busy drafting her speech for the conference.
draft.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to order someone to join the army, navy etc, especially during a war
draft.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: My dad was eighteen when he got drafted into the army.
draft.translation[1].definitions[1].note: Draft is usually passive in this meaning
draft.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to choose a college player to join a professional team
draft.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Craigwell was drafted by the Chicago Blackhawks.
draft.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: a document or piece of writing that has to be checked and possibly changed, and so is not yet in its finished form
draft.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: This is only a rough draft of the letter.
When can I have the first draft of your proposal?
a draft report, which the Committee has read and considered in detail.
draft.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: to write a letter, report etc that will need to be changed before it is in its finished form
draft.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: I’ll ask our contracts department to draft an agreement.
